means: 开导，启发( edify的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He must be edified by what he sees.
sentence.Network_cn: 他耳濡目染,一定也受到影响.

sentence.Network_en: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.
sentence.Network_cn: 你感谢的固然是好, 无奈不能造就别人.

sentence.Network_en: The audience were much edified by this passage of words.
sentence.Network_cn: 在座的听众从他这番话里获益匪浅.

list.abs: 另是从事解构活动的「成德哲学」 (edifying philosophy) ， 中观哲学即是属于后者。
...，因此严格一点说，它不是一套细密的系统哲学，而是“成德的哲学”（edifying philosophy）。
Young students are advised to read edifying books to improve their mind ., 建议青年学生们读一些陶冶性情的书籍 , 以提高自己的心智.
a mode of biblical interpretation insisting on the morally edifying sense of tropes in the Scriptures .据引串文解释强调圣经中比喻的道德教化意义的阐释模式
the paintings in the church served an edifying purpose even for those who could not read .教堂中的绘画都有教化作用，即使对于读不懂它们的人也有这种作用。

means.word_mean: 1. instructed and encouraged in moral, intellectual, and spiritual improvement

auth_sentence.content: The names of all who had died in the convent since it was edified.
auth_sentence.res_content: The names of all who had died in the convent since it was edified.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The names of all who had died in the convent since it was edified.

auth_sentence.content: The defendant edified himself by turning over many new leaves in Gandhi's autobiography The Story of My Experiments with Truth.
auth_sentence.res_content: The defendant edified himself by turning over many new leaves in Gandhi's autobiography The Story of My Experiments with Truth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The defendant edified himself by turning over many new leaves in Gandhi's autobiography The Story of My Experiments with Truth.
